item.title: Report E-2024050333
item.description:
Report E-2024050333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 15-gallon plastic jug of Liquid Laundry Chlorine Bleach. The container was punctured by a forklift accident. This resulted in an estimated 15-gallon release of hazardous product onto the wooden trailer floor and a the concrete beneath the trailer. The trailer floor was impacted in an approximate area of 8’x6’ and the concrete beneath the trailer was impacted in an approximate area of 9’x21’. A Contractor was dispatched to assist in the clean-up and used oil dry and absorbent pads. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal that included the overpacked, damaged jug and the impacted absorbents. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024050340
item.description:
Report E-2024050340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a leaking cap on a plastic tote containing Alumni-Clean. A Contractor was called to assist with the clean-up and swap out the leaking cap. A Contractor determined that the cap was mis-thread and was able to apply to cap correctly and securely. A slosh test was performed and it was determined that the tote was safe to ship on to the Consignee. One drum of waste was generated that container the impacted absorbent pads used to clean the release and the Contractor’s PPE. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
